cf.lukasheinzl.syntax

Class Formatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • cf.lukasheinzl.syntax.Formatter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WordFormatter

    public class Formatter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to applied formats to tokens.
    Author:
    Lukas Heinzl

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Formatter(Format startFmt, Format endFmt)
      Constructs a new formatter with the given start and end formats.

      Checks if this formatter can be used or not

    • Constructor Detail

      • Formatter

        public Formatter(Format startFmt,
                 Format endFmt)
        Constructs a new formatter with the given start and end formats.
        Parameters:
        startFmt - The format to apply at the start of this formated region (example: /*)
        endFmt - The format to apply at the end of this formated region (example: */)

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public java.lang.String process(Token input)
        Processes the input token and applies the correct format, if any, to it
        Parameters:
        input - The token to apply the format to
        Returns:
        The formatted string or null if not applicable

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked()
        Checks if this formatter can be used or not
        Returns:
        False if no locking formatters are active and all needed formatters are active

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns if this formatter is currently active
        Returns:
        If this formatter is currently active

      • setLocks

        public void setLocks(Formatter... locks)
        Sets the locking formatters
        Parameters:
        locks - The locking formatters

      • setNeeds

        public void setNeeds(Formatter... needs)
        Sets the needed formatters
        Parameters:
        needs - The needed formatters
